newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swissca funds sees assets rise 24 percent yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: Swissca funds sees assets rise 24 percent yr/yr.

text.p: Swissca Holding AG, a joint venture among Swiss cantonal banks, said it had boosted the volume of funds under management by 24 percent to more than 11.5 billion Swiss francs in the year to mid-1996.
Swissca's 42 investment funds are its most important activity. It plans to launch another fund specialising in emerging markets in November.

It said its Swissca Portfolio Management AG unit had also expanded by offering its services for the first time to large institutional customers. This had boosted volume by around one billion francs, it said in a statement.

It said it stepped up securities trading, which is conducted via its Swissca Securities Ltd unit in London. Eurobond trading volume rose 20 percent to $21.2 billion while volume in British stocks went up 17 percent to more than $1 billion.
